comments:
This course is an introduction to Python programming, using assignments to expose students to a wide range of library modules.

Students found the content to be “rewarding” and reported learning a significant amount about Python programming and “programming in general.”

Students found Adam Aviv to be an “enthusiastic instructor” who cared about students learning the material.

The amount of work required for this class exceeded expectations for a half-credit course. Students frequently noted that homework assignments were “surprisingly long” and a lot of work. However, students did enjoy that no exams were given, as they felt this led them to focus more on learning the concepts.
